result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation to be with the mental health unit.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a course in anger m management.
Complete parenting classes.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Random drug screens.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all nonwaivable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Carmelo Arroyo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Joel Carmelo Arroyo.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing hearing held. Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 4 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Random drug screens.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Probation to be with the mental health unit.
- Vocational and educational training.
- Complete 30 hours of community service.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Joel Carmelo Arroyo.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Court VACATED jury trial. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Filed: Jury Instructions, Amended Information, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights,
Defendant's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk
Defendant's Motion in Limine.  Received and Filed.  nk
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk

Court rescheduled final pre-trial as requested and will address joinder motion at next court date.  Jury status hearing remains calendared on September 30, 2022 at 8:30 AM.  Jury Trial remains calendared on October 3, 2022 at 8:30 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear by video.  Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Schlachter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2 on behalf of the defendant. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
